```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
options(scipen = 99)
```




Create a data frame with the income data

```{r}
income_data <- data.frame(
  Income = c("Bottom 20%", "Second 20%", "Third 20%", "Fourth 20%", "Next 15%", "Next 4%", "Top 1%"),
  Income_Range_Start = c(0, 25000, 52000, 84000, 135000, 270000, 626000),
  Income_Range_End = c(25000, 52000, 84000, 135000, 270000, 626000, 2000000),
  Average_Income = c(13000, 38000, 67000, 111000, 183000, 376000, 1403000)
)
```


Calculate the average for each income category

```{r}
income_data <- transform(income_data, Average_Income = ifelse(Income == "Top 1%", Average_Income, (Income_Range_Start + Income_Range_End) / 2))
```



Create the box plot with average

```{r}
ggplot(income_data, aes(x = Income, y = Average_Income)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(x = "Income Range", y = "Average Income") +
  ggtitle("Income Distribution") +
  theme_minimal()

```
